result.execSummary:
The defendant Victor A Boyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to:  any other sentence.  Straight time.
PROBATION REVIEW HEARING AUGUST 7, 2015 AT 1:30 P.M. IN BR. 23.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharges during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court waived all nonmandatory Court costs, fees and surcharges.
Obtain/maintain employment, school or a combination of both.

Provide a DNA sample.
Defendant can complete terms through BMCW.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of No Contact Order.
Court advised that under 48USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession; and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

No contact with J.J.B. unless approved by Court, Children's Court or BMCW.
No contact with firearms.

A course in anger management.
Parenting classes.
Cooperate with Children's Court Orders.
Absolute sobriety.
Cognitive thinking class.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Victor A Boyd

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  Review hearing is cancelled.
cab

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 57 DAYS time served, straight time.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 100 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-A course in anger management.
-Parenting classes.
-Mental health evaluation.
-Cooperate with Children's Court Orders.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Cognitive Thinking Class.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with J.J.B. unless approved by court, children's court, or BMCW..
-Obtain/maintain employment, school, or a combination of both.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Defendant can complete terms through BMCW.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. 

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation
-Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Victor A Boyd in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant Victor A Boyd in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Plea & Sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Physical Abuse of a Child (Reckless Causation of Bodily Harm), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.03(3)(b), a Class I Felony.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Certification of PRELIMINARY HEARING transcript commencing FEBRUARY 24, 2015, received and filed. (18 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to:  PUBLIC DEFENDER.

Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court, defendant Victor A Boyd not in court, in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Second call. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date, court granted. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court, defendant Victor A Boyd not in court, in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. First call- Court ordered case passed to address court calendar.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Matthew Bughman-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23.

Defendant Victor A Boyd in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Defendant Victor A Boyd in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Flanagan.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grady, Br. 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JJB (2/16/11).

Defendant Victor A Boyd in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Victor A Boyd in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Victor A Boyd
Current: 3424 N 7th St., Milwaukee, WI 53212   (Effective: 02-16-2015)
Prior: 3221 North Palmer Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
